I did feel a small lump so I called my GYN and couldn't get in for a few months (3 I think). When I went she felt it and said it was fibroidcystic.  I thought ok, and promptly didn't get the mammogram. Two years later I went back!  For all I know I might have been dealing with DCIS stage 0 or something. At the very least not as many nodes involved if at all.  I can't beat myself up about it, just glad I took care of it at all. Saved my life.

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2014 04:24PM HomeMom wrote: It is great you are having it checked out. You don't know what you don't know so don't freak out over this just yet. Even IF it is bc, you've more then likely found it very early and that is important.  As far as your "risk factors" you really can't go on that. I had my first child at 26, my period at 13, I breast fed and no ZERO bc in my family. I don't really even have cancer in my family.  So while I leaned heavily on those factors, you can't rely heavily on yours. Take a deep breath and let it play out. They say 80% of suspicious lumps are benign.  Take care, I hope it is nothing!
